main.name: Felix Fernandez
main.bio: Innovative, deadline-driven and problem solving Full Stack Developer with 4 + years of experience designing and developing for a corporation everyday. I love technology and problem solving I'm always looking how to make things more efficient, and when the opportunity arrives I always try to teach myself new things since I love learning.
main.contactmessage: If you wish to get in touch with me just state your name and your business and I will get back to you as soon as I get the chance.

resume.message: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: Certification in Data Science and Machine Learning

education.comment: Minor in Computer Science and Mathematics

work.title: Full Stack Developer
work.description: I specialize in architecting and implementing Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes, notably spearheading the development of a sophisticated system geared towards automating critical End-of-Month (EOM) financial procedures. My technical prowess is showcased through the strategic utilization of Angular for front-end development, C#.NET Core API for robust back-end architecture, and MS SQL for efficient database management. In addition to my core responsibilities, I play a pivotal role as an integral member of the AI team, contributing to advanced predictive analytics for revenue and other financial metrics. My contributions extend beyond ETL refinement to encompass addressing diverse financial requirements and report generation.

work.title: Full Stack Developer
work.description: I programmed, updated, and maintained various web apps, department websites, applications, and databases. As part of this work, I restructured and redesigned web apps to improve their integration with databases. Additionally, I created and edited forms for upload on multiple servers and websites. To enhance workflow and application maintenance, I consolidated 12 databases into a single comprehensive database. I was responsible for maintaining and managing the Guest Sign-in System, utilizing PHP and MySQL databases. Furthermore, I updated and managed the Student Staff Portal using JavaScript, and implemented APIs for data retrieval and Cron-Jobs for data pushing and process automation in the Student Sign-in System. I also debugged and modified the schema of the Staff Admin Portal for improved onboarding of new staff. Successfully upgrading the entire system to a new server was another achievement. Alongside these tasks, I developed and updated websites, both front and back end. I implemented Cron Jobs on Linux to generate notification actions and created a fully functional developer instance for testing purposes, ensuring separation from live sites. I also utilized Git for system backups and documented processes using Confluence. Currently, I am leading a team of developers in the department and providing training to new student programmers in the Department of Residence Life.

portfolio.portfolio_title: Check Out Some of My Works

projects.title: Extract Master
projects.description: Developed a centralized ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) system that would allows for all extraction types and allow the data to be transformed to any data type to be pushed to any database. The system would also have a data score on the front for users to check what happened to the extraction and change the configuration of it.

projects.title: DataFarm
projects.description: Developed a system that completely automates the End Of Month process (EOM) for finance and provides them with live data in their reports.

projects.title: Netflix Movie Recommendation
projects.description: To enhance customer satisfaction and improve revenue, I built a **Recommendation System** that suggests relevant movies to users based on their historical interactions.

projects.title: Hotel Booking Cancellation Prediction
projects.description: The increasing number of cancellations in the hotel industry demands a Machine Learning-based solution to predict which bookings are likely to be canceled.

projects.title: Pima Indians Diabetes Analysis
projects.description: Here, I'am analyzing different aspects of Diabetes in the Pima Diabetes Analysis by doing Exploratory Data Analysis.

projects.title: Sign in System
projects.description: Developed a secure sign-in system for Res-Life to manage student entries, guest tracking, and monitoring of services, packages, and keys in dormitories.

projects.title: Southern Virtual Tour
projects.description: Developed a virtual tour of the university, enabling users to explore the campus and building interiors virtually.

projects.title: Staff Admin Portal
projects.description: The Staff Administration Portal is a web application streamlining employee permission management within the Residence Life system.

projects.title: Graphics Portal
projects.description: Developed an app for Southern Connecticut State University's graphic designers to manage and maintain a list of requests, functioning as a ticket system.

projects.title: OA Portal
projects.description: Developed an app for Southern Connecticut State University's Operation Assistants to manage and maintain a list of requests, operating as a ticket system.

projects.title: Card-App
projects.description: Developed an application for Southern Connecticut State University to provide temporary ID cards as a solution for residents or students facing ID-related issues.

projects.title: Happy Children Daycare
projects.description: Developed a website for parents to register, sign in, enroll children in daycare, and communicate with caretakers. Employees can also sign in, view work schedules, and access assigned children's information.

projects.title: Collaborative Information Center
projects.description: The app allows user registration with email verification, job listing creation, and applications. Email notifications provide updates, and employers can access employee information.

projects.title: Air Chat
projects.description: Developed an encrypted instant messaging web app with real-time communication using Flask and Socket.io. Users create usernames and join chat rooms using room numbers to prevent packet capture software interception.
